The flea market at the Ashby BART station parking lot has served as a gathering space for South Berkeley’s Black community and residents of color for nearly 50 years. A new housing development will likely relocate it.

Is this the world’s last ‘affordable’ city for home buyers? And how the Bay Area compares

Of the 92 housing markets in eight countries examined in a new report, just one remained “affordable” when measuring home prices in relation to income: Pittsburgh. By comparison, San Francisco and San Jose were the 86th and 89th most affordable, respectively.

Preston now represents the Tenderloin, San Francisco’s most watched neighborhood. He may be scrutinized by residents and business owners who are concerned that he voted against Mayor London Breed’s state of emergency to address the area’s fatal overdoses and crime.
